title: Mariscal Santa Cruz
text:
Club Mariscal Santa Cruz, was a Bolivian <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> club based in the city of <a href="La%20Paz%2C%20Bolivia">La Paz, Bolivia</a>, named in honour of <a href="Andr%C3%A9s%20de%20Santa%20Cruz">Andrés de Santa Cruz</a>, former President of <a href="Peru">Peru</a> and <a href="Bolivia">Bolivia</a>.
It was founded in 1923 as "Northern Football Club", in 1966 the club changed its name, after it had been sold to the Bolivian Armed Forces due to financial difficulties.
Mariscal Santa Cruz played in the "Liga Paceña de Futbol" the semi-amateur football league of the Bolivian Capital from its formation in 1950 until 1976 when the club was dissolved.
Mariscal Santa Cruz first and only appearance in an international Official <a href="CONMEBOL">CONMEBOL</a> tournament was the <a href="Copa%20Ganadores%20de%20Copa">Copa Ganadores de Copa</a> 1970, played in <a href="La%20Paz%2C%20Bolivia">La Paz, Bolivia</a>. The club won the tournament, the first and thus far only Bolivian club so to do.
In 1976 the club was dissolved by the then Bolivian President, General <a href="Hugo%20Banzer">Hugo Banzer</a>.
